description: Inherited from Middle English essoyne, from Old French essoignier, from Medieval Latin exoniō, essoniō (“excuse oneself; accept an excuse”), from ex- + sonium + -ō, sonium being from Proto-West Germanic *sunnju (“care, need”).

entries.meaning: (UK, law, obsolete) An excuse for not appearing in court at the return of process; the allegation of an excuse to the court.

verbs.description: essoin (third-person singular simple present essoins, present participle essoining, simple past and past participle essoined)

entries.meaning: (UK, law, transitive) To excuse for failure to appear in court.
